topics: Overview of Python and its history
Installing Python and setting up the development environment
Introduction to IDEs (Integrated Development Environments) like PyCharm, VSCode, or Jupyter Notebooks
Writing and running your first Python program
Primitive data types: integers, floats, strings, and booleans
Basic operators: arithmetic, comparison, logical, and assignment
Conditional statements: if, elif, and else
Looping constructs: for and while loops
Lists: creation, indexing, slicing, and methods
Dictionaries: key-value pairs, methods, and operations
Scope of variables: local and global
Importing modules and using standard libraries
Overview of popular packages (e.g., NumPy, Pandas)
Reading from and writing to files
Working with CSV and JSON files
Exception handling: try, except, else, and finally
Overview of data analysis libraries (NumPy, Pandas)
Introduction to data cleaning and preprocessing
Introduction to web scraping using BeautifulSoup or Scrapy
Basics of web development with Flask or Django
Final project: A comprehensive project integrating learned concepts (e.g., a simple web application, data analysis project, or automation script)

Implementing flexible images and grid systems

Common accessibility issues and how to avoid them
Future trends in HTML and web development
